physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Left lower extremity was 6 cm shorter than the right, knee extensor mechanism insufficient, unilateral crouched gait, active extension lag of 40°, passive range of motion of the knee from 10° to 130° with a 10° flexion contracture. Absence of patellar engagement with the patellofemoral groove even with maximum knee flexion. No patellar tendon palpable. Patellar mobility and stability normal, the knee stable and not painful.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Active extension lag improved from 40° postoperatively to 35° one year postoperatively but then deteriorated to 60° extension lag two years postoperatively.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Walked with the involved extremity externally rotated by 30° to 40°, right femur was 2 cm shorter than the left femur, with passive range of motion of the right knee from 5° to 150° of flexion and an active extension lag of 30°. Patella was palpable and mobile but positioned proximal to the patellofemoral groove (patella alta). Normal ranges of motion at the hip and ankle; contralateral extremity normal.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: No change in condition noted; the gait remained slightly impaired, and the knee extension lag stayed at 30° two years later.
